verses.kjv: In the year that king Uzziah died I saw also the LORD sitting upon a throne, high and lifted up, and his train filled the temple.
verses.ct: During the year that King Uzziah died, I had a vision of the LORD seated on a throne, towering and exalted, and the edges of his robe filled the entire temple.

verses.kjv: Above it stood the seraphims: each one had six wings; with twain he covered his face, and with twain he covered his feet, and with twain he did fly.
verses.ct: Seraphim hovered above him, each with 6 wings: they used 2 to cover their faces, 2 to cover their feet, and 2 to fly.

verses.kjv: And one cried unto another, and said, Holy, holy, holy, is the LORD of hosts: the whole earth is full of his glory.
verses.ct: They called out to one another, saying, 'Holy, holy, holy is the LORD of hosts — the whole earth is full of his glory!'

verses.kjv: And the posts of the door moved at the voice of him that cried, and the house was filled with smoke.
verses.ct: The doorframes shook at the sound of their voices, and the temple filled with smoke.

verses.kjv: Then said I, Woe is me! for I am undone; because I am a man of unclean lips, and I dwell in the midst of a people of unclean lips: for mine eyes have seen the King, the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: I cried out, 'I'm ruined! I'm destroyed, because my lips are impure, and I live among a people whose lips are impure — yet my own eyes have seen the King, the LORD of hosts!'

verses.kjv: Then flew one of the seraphims unto me, having a live coal in his hand, which he had taken with the tongs from off the altar:
verses.ct: Then one of the seraphim flew over to me, holding a burning coal that he had picked up with tongs from the altar.

verses.kjv: And he laid it upon my mouth, and said, Lo, this hath touched thy lips; and thine iniquity is taken away, and thy sin purged.
verses.ct: He pressed it against my mouth and said, 'See, this has touched your lips. Your guilt is removed, and your sin is wiped clean.'

verses.kjv: Also I heard the voice of the Lord, saying, Whom shall I send, and who will go for us? Then said I, Here am I; send me.
verses.ct: Then I heard the voice of the Lord saying, 'Who should I send? Who will go on our behalf?' I answered, 'I'm right here — send me!'

verses.kjv: And he said, Go, and tell this people, Hear ye indeed, but understand not; and see ye indeed, but perceive not.
verses.ct: He replied, 'Go and tell this people: Keep on listening, but never understand. Keep on looking, but never grasp what you see.'

verses.kjv: Make the heart of this people fat, and make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes; lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and convert, and be healed.
verses.ct: 'Make the hearts of this people dull, their ears unresponsive, and their eyes shut tight — so that they won't see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their hearts, and turn back and be healed.'

verses.kjv: Then said I, Lord, how long? And he answered, Until the cities be wasted without inhabitant, and the houses without man, and the land be utterly desolate,
verses.ct: I asked, 'Lord, how long will this go on?' He answered, 'Until cities are left in ruins with no one living in them, until houses stand empty, and the land is completely devastated,

verses.kjv: And the LORD have removed men far away, and there be a great forsaking in the midst of the land.
verses.ct: until the LORD has sent everyone far away, and the abandonment across the land is total.'

verses.kjv: But yet in it shall be a tenth, and it shall return, and shall be eaten: as a teil tree, and as an oak, whose substance is in them, when they cast their leaves: so the holy seed shall be the substance thereof.
verses.ct: 'But even so, a 10th will remain. It will be ravaged again, yet like a terebinth or an oak that still has life in its stump after being cut down, the holy seed will be the life within that stump.'
